image.altText: Headshot of 15yo boy Elliott Senior wearing a halo neck and back brace

props.synopsis: Since the beginning of October, 14 children have presented to South Australia's Women's and Children's Hospital with mountain bike injuries – some of them life threatening.

title.children: 'Never seen anything like it': Surge in number of mountain bike injuries at Adelaide hospital prompts warning from authorities

image.altText: The back of a police officer wearing a blue police jacket and cap, with a red fire truck in the background

props.synopsis: Police released the review three days before they were set to given evidence at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence — after a four-month-long fight to block the ABC's freedom of information request.

title.children: Document SA Police fought to keep secret reveals DV 'victim blaming' concerns within government unit

image.altText: A woman stands next to a large painting of herself dressed in a yellow gown and feather boa

props.synopsis: Broken Hill local June Marie Bennett, who played Shirl in The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, is remembered by friends and family as "a born performer" with an "incredible love for life".

title.children: Outback icon known for role in cult classic Priscilla, Queen of the Desert dies aged 85

image.altText: Man in suit at steps of Parliament House

props.synopsis: The station announces its 2025 line-up, with Spence Denny to present Evenings, and ABC political reporter Rory McClaren to fill the role of David Bevan after he retires in December.

title.children: New schedules for familiar voices and Rory McClaren to refresh ABC Radio Adelaide's line-up in 2025

image.altText: Sid Draper looks to get a handball away under pressure

props.synopsis: Homegrown midfielder Sid Draper will be heading to West Lakes after being selected by the Crows with pick four in last night's AFL Draft, while the Power has plumped for 18-year-old Joe Berry.

title.children: Crows select Sid Draper with pick four as Power opts for Joe Berry at AFL Draft

image.altText: A Highland cattle stands in a field with the sun setting behind it

props.synopsis: Olaf, a speckled bullock, and Rahley, a Highland bullock, went missing from their respective properties in the greater Adelaide region within days of each other.

title.children: 'Now it's too coincidental': Owners plead for return of beloved pets

image.altText: A woman on a beach with severely weathered ropes around her neck

props.synopsis: Kangaroo Island tour guides Mia Bertetto and Nikki Redman say they have a blunt message for tourists and locals — "don't garbage paradise".

title.children: The 'heartbreaking, never-ending' rubbish on Australia's third-largest island

image.altText: A blue sculpture on a footpath outside a historic building

props.synopsis: A sculpture design has caused a stir in a regional South Australian community, but the local council says that is the point of public art.

title.children: Mount Gambier's 'blue blob' sculpture to go ahead, despite fierce online backlash

image.altText: A baby sits against a white background smiling wearing a white shirt and flowery pants

props.synopsis: A police officer who spoke with the mother of a baby who was killed by her father in a murder-suicide at the Whispering Wall in South Australia's Barossa Valley has broken down in tears as she described how she could have handled the file differently.

title.children: SA police officer breaks down during inquest into death of baby Kobi, saying she missed threats to kill in father's file

image.altText: Elderly woman sits on her bed longingly holding an old black and white photo of her younger self next to her late husband.

props.synopsis: When Shirley met the love of her life at age 19, Australian society didn't allow her and her soulmate to be together.

title.children: The enduring love story that defied the White Australia policy

image.altText: Screengrab of mobile vision showing people with blurred faces standing under an awning.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney-General and Aboriginal Affairs Minister Kyam Maher has spoken to the state's Police Commissioner, following "confronting" footage taken during an arrest near Port Augusta at the weekend.

title.children: 'Confronting' vision of a man being dragged by police has prompted a formal assessment — what happened and what is the response?

image.altText: black and white image of koala on podium

props.synopsis: Commercial radio started with a bang in Adelaide after a live broadcast of federal election results in 1925 prompted a police response when 5,000 people gathered outside the studio of 5CL, which would later become the ABC.

title.children: From amateur broadcasts reaching New York, to the ABC and SA-FM's Skyshow, Adelaide celebrates 100 years of radio

image.altText: readbook2

props.synopsis: A government department says it will stop partnering with a charity run by Plymouth Brethren Christian Church members. A school run by church members has also been referred to regulators following allegations that students are discouraged from attending on-campus university.

title.children: SA Health to cut ties with charity run by Brethren members, school referred to regulators

image.altText: A selfie of Oleander Glenie, who has short-cropped brown hair and is laying on his bed with his cat

props.synopsis: Oleander Glenie is a trans man from Adelaide/Tarntanya, who shares what it was like being diagnosed with autism in his 20s.

title.children: I was meek, shy and undemanding. It's part of why my autism diagnosis was missed

image.altText: An illustration shows a pregnant woman sitting cross-legged while a woman with halo leans down to touch her belly

props.synopsis: They check the baby's position and listen to the heartbeat, but they aren't qualified midwives. Parents say a "dangerous" new breed of birth worker has emerged to fill the gap for women wanting to birth outside hospital.

title.children: 'Sovereign midwife' who thought baby's shoulder was a head linked to three baby deaths

image.altText: A black and white image of Lazar competing in the games 2023.

props.synopsis: The investigation into Lazar Ðukić's drowning at this year's CrossFit Games is complete, but the organisation is criticised for not releasing the full report.

title.children: CrossFit criticised for not releasing full investigation into Lazar Ðukić's drowning at 2024 Games

image.altText: A portrait of Mineral Resources managing director Chris Ellison

props.synopsis: The ASX closed lower on Thursday after Bitcoin set a new record high. Shares in Mineral Resources also sank as the company faced investor revolt after a tax scandal. Coles is facing the ACCC's supermarket inquiry as hundreds of Woolworths warehouse workers went on strike.

title.children: Mineral Resources fronts angry investors after tax scandal, ASX closes lower after Bitcoin hits record high — as it happened

image.altText: White split toed shoes.

props.synopsis: Inspired by footwear worn by construction workers in Japan, tabi shoes are turning heads from Hollywood to Melbourne. What makes them so special?

title.children: The tradie footwear from Japan selling for $1,500 and seen on catwalks everywhere

image.altText: Professor Richard Scolyer smiles, wearing a collared shirt and black jacket

props.synopsis: After 18 months and 14 doses of revolutionary experimental treatment, Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer gives an update on his latest brain scan, cautioning that these results "could just be luck".

title.children: 'Blown away I'm still here': Richard Scolyer still cancer-free 18 months into revolutionary treatment

image.altText: Woman in radio studio with headphones and microphone on head.

props.synopsis: Investigative reporter and former foreign correspondent Linton Besser will be replacing Paul Barry as the host of Media Watch as part of an ABC staff shake-up in 2025.

title.children: Fran Kelly returns to daily broadcasting, Linton Besser to replace Paul Barry as Media Watch host in 2025

image.altText: Close up photo of young woman with red hair, eyebrow and nose piercings

props.synopsis: The family of 19-year-old Isla Bell say they are trying to process the "unimaginable" after her remains were believed to have been found at a Melbourne tip.

title.children: 'Her hopes and dreams have been taken away': Isla Bell's family grieves after men charged over her death

image.altText: A silhouette of a pregnant woman outside.

props.synopsis: A new report shows only 6 per cent of child protection funding goes to Aboriginal-run organisations, despite these groups often posting better outcomes.

title.children: First Nations children are being removed from families at highest levels ever recorded

image.altText: A man speaking into a microphone, seen from close up

props.synopsis: Billionaires are playing an increasing role in US politics, and while some are very visible, several legal rulings have paved the way for other mega-wealthy donors to splash their cash and cover their tracks.

title.children: 'Broligarchs' now run the US, and their dark money is hard to trace

image.altText: banana duct taped to a white wall

props.synopsis: A piece of conceptual art consisting of a banana duct-taped to a wall has sold for $US6.2 million ($9.57 million) at an auction in New York.

title.children: Banana taped to wall sells for nearly $10 million at auction

image.altText: Namila Benson, with flowing black dress and bright auburn hair, smiles widely surrounded by shrubs and a path.

props.synopsis: On Thursday, the ABC announced its content slate for 2025, across broadcast and digital platforms, including six arts series.

title.children: ABC announces broadcasting plans for 2025 with focus on the arts

image.altText: Three women wearing green, blue and red saris sew at sewing machines in a line.

props.synopsis: The fast fashion giant behind Millers, Rivers and Katies has left factories in Bangladesh scrambling for reportedly more than $30 million in unpaid invoices — and the fallout threatens the livelihoods of thousands of women.

title.children: Garment workers fear their children will go hungry after Australian fast fashion brand's collapse

image.altText: A Woolworths logo in Adelaide's Rundle Mall

props.synopsis: The supermarket giant told Australia's competition watchdog its competition went far beyond Coles, Aldi, and Costco, and that it was spending millions on its online offerings to prepare with Amazon as an emerging competitor.

title.children: Woolworths spends millions as emerging competitor Amazon encroaches on similar products

image.altText: Woman with dark curly shoulder length hair and light brown skin sits in front of a laptop in an office late at night

props.synopsis: The latest report predicts rapid growth in the clean energy workforce, science industry and healthcare and disability sector.

title.children: Some of the jobs of the future are only just emerging, and they don't all need a uni degree

image.altText: two chinese men standing next to each other with their faces blurred

props.synopsis: An Indigenous ranger group that rescued four asylum seekers on a remote island off the Northern Territory coast last week is calling for the federal government to guarantee their safety.

title.children: 'He said if he's sent back to China, he'll be killed': Rangers question future of asylum seekers found in remote NT

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: MPs from both sides of politics ask about proposed laws to re-detain people released from immigration detention by the High Court, saying they could limit as many as 10 separate human rights.

title.children: Bill to re-detain NZYQ cohort may impinge on 10 separate human rights

image.altText: A woman covers her face with her hand as she appears on a video call

props.synopsis: Susan Smith said her sons had been abducted by a black man, before confessing to killing both of them after nine days of searching.

title.children: 'That's only 15 years per child': Mother who killed toddler sons in 1994 murder denied bail after 30 years behind bars

image.altText: A sheikh delivering a televised address in front of a blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: Israel and Hezbollah appear unwilling to compromise on how a proposed ceasefire deal between the two sides would be enforced, with the Israeli government saying it wants "the freedom to act" within Lebanon.

title.children: Hezbollah vows retaliation in Tel Aviv as sticking point holds up truce negotiations

image.altText: A black and white photo of Liam Payne is stuck to a pole with the words 'rest in peace' written on it

props.synopsis: The family and friends of the late One Direction star came together at a small service outside of London to farewell Liam Payne, who died last month.

title.children: Liam Payne farewelled by One Direction bandmates, stars and family at funeral
